title.native: ユーリ!!! on ICE 劇場版 : ICE ADOLESCENCE
title.romaji: Yuuri!!! on ICE The Movie: ICE ADOLESCENCE

tags.name: Ice Skating
tags.description: Centers around the sport of ice skating.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山本沙代) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sayo_Yamamoto)

Renowed Anime Director, known for the critically acclaimed anime series [Michiko & Hatchin](https://anilist.co/anime/4087/Michiko-to-Hatchin/), [Lupin the Third: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine](https://anilist.co/anime/13203/Lupin-the-Third-Mine-Fujiko-to-Iu-Onna/) and [Yuri on Ice](https://anilist.co/anime/21709/Yuri-on-Ice/).

After graduating from the College of Art and Design in Tokyo she joined Studio Madhouse as Production Assistant. She had her directing debut at age 25 on [X](https://anilist.co/anime/156/X-TV/) after which she became freelance.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Persona 5 (Video Game, 2016) (OP Director, Storyboard)

A Japanese manga artist, writer, and radio personality. She is known for writing on [Yuri!!! on Ice](https://anilist.co/anime/21709/Yuri-on-Ice/), an anime series co-created with [Sayo Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/101856/Sayo-Yamamoto). Two of her manga have been released in English; [Moteki](https://anilist.co/manga/44701/Moteki/) by Vertical and [Again!!](https://anilist.co/manga/65013/Again/) by Kodansha USA. She and Mineko Nomachi have a radio program called Mitsurou Kubo and Mineko Nomachi's All Night Nippon.

A Japanese manga artist, writer, and radio personality. She is known for writing on [Yuri!!! on Ice](https://anilist.co/anime/21709/Yuri-on-Ice/), an anime series co-created with [Sayo Yamamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/101856/Sayo-Yamamoto). Two of her manga have been released in English; [Moteki](https://anilist.co/manga/44701/Moteki/) by Vertical and [Again!!](https://anilist.co/manga/65013/Again/) by Kodansha USA. She and Mineko Nomachi have a radio program called Mitsurou Kubo and Mineko Nomachi's All Night Nippon.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山本沙代) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sayo_Yamamoto)

Renowed Anime Director, known for the critically acclaimed anime series [Michiko & Hatchin](https://anilist.co/anime/4087/Michiko-to-Hatchin/), [Lupin the Third: The Woman Called Fujiko Mine](https://anilist.co/anime/13203/Lupin-the-Third-Mine-Fujiko-to-Iu-Onna/) and [Yuri on Ice](https://anilist.co/anime/21709/Yuri-on-Ice/).

After graduating from the College of Art and Design in Tokyo she joined Studio Madhouse as Production Assistant. She had her directing debut at age 25 on [X](https://anilist.co/anime/156/X-TV/) after which she became freelance.

**Notable works outside anime:**
- Persona 5 (Video Game, 2016) (OP Director, Storyboard)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/156204341) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hiramatz/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/tadashi-hiramatz/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@hiramatz1963)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Although at first becoming a salary man after graduation, he later decided to become animator and joined Nakamura Production, where he debuted on [Bugtte Honey](https://anilist.co/anime/10210/) in 1987. He later joined Studio Gainax and was involved in the production of [Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/). In 1998 he debuted as character designer of [Kare Kano](https://anilist.co/anime/145/Kareshi-Kanojo-no-Jijou/).

Started playing piano in elementary school. After graduating high school, he entered an era of being influenced by new wave, Serge Gainsbourg, Jon Brion and so on. He finally learned composition and orchestration in Tokyo University of the Arts Music Department, During his days in University, he signed to Rallye Label in August 2012 under the name milk.

([Source](http://piano.tt/umebayashi))
